attributes.action: Replace compulsory Religious Education on the National Curriculum with Philosophy to KS3 level
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Religious Education on the National Curriculum really is shocking: I have experienced it first-hand. It provides no benefit to 'religious tolerance' and at GCSE level, each school is tied to a syllabus considering only one faith (usually Christianity in schools that do not have an overwhelming proportion of pupils of another faith; Atheism is an irrelevance), which is not only offensive and patronising, but useless in a society in which schools contain members of numerous faiths, not to mention a considerable proportion to whom religion is irrelevant. Courses in Philosophy, right from Key Stage One, however, would promote depth of thought, intellectual calibre and a healthy, logical and critical approach to the world in general which is often lacking in so many who never consider Philosophical questions. I believe that this would be far more beneficial to individuals in the future than a basic knowledge of each of the world's main religions and/or a detailed knowledge of one in particular (usually Christianity). Leave Religious Education for Religious Schools and individuals who study it out of choice!
